title: Former Xaverian DT Maurice Hurst Jr. named to the Bednarik Watch List | High School Insider | with Danny Ventura & Jim Clark
text:
Former Herald All-Scholastic defensive tackle Maurice Hurst Jr. of Xaverian (now playing at Michigan) has been added to the Chuck Bednarik Award Watch List on Thursday (Oct. 15) by the Maxwell Football Club, it was recently announced.
Hurst has played in 14 career games, including all six this season. After appearing in eight games as a sophomore last year, Hurst picked up his first career sack this year against UNLV (Sept. 19). He added another pair of sacks in the ensuing weeks (vs. BYU, at Maryland) and owns four tackles-for-loss on the year.
The Chuck Bednarik Award has been presented since 1995 to the nation's top defensive player. The award is named in honor of Chuck Bednarik, a member of both the College Football Hall of Fame (Class of 1969) and NFL Hall of Fame (Class of 1967).
Semifinalists for the award will be announced on Monday, Nov. 2, and three finalists for the award will be announced on Tuesday, Nov. 24. The award winner will be announced as part of the Home Depot College Football Awards Show, to be held on Thursday, Dec. 10, at the College Football Hall of Fame in Atlanta.
Watch list candidates have been chosen by the Maxwell Football Club's Selection Committee and the Maxwell Club reserves the right to make additions and subtractions to this list as the 2015 season unfolds.
Hurst was an All-Scholastic selection in 2012 as he recorded 51 tackles and 11 sacks. Below are some of his senior highlights at Xaverian from his youtube channel.
